page.title: 17Choirs in Much Wenlock.
page.content: {The Male Voice Choir}was formed in {1968}with{12 singers.}Now they have{48 {members}who sing in four parts-first and second tenors and first and second bass. They meet weekly for rehearsals at The William Brookes School. The average age of the members is 40. {The Much Wenlock Ladies Choir}was formed in{1969.}It has about{24 members who sing in three parts-first soprano, second soprano and alto. They meet weekly during term time at The William Brookes School. Both choirs give{concerts}at different times of the year both in Much Wenlock and other towns and villages. Both choirs were originally formed by {The Bridgnorth College of Further {Education}under the title "Singing For Pleasure" but they are now{independent of this college.
